comments.body:
Hi. Thank you for making a PR.
However, GitHub Action shows the compilation error. Is this compiled in your environment?
```
[ERROR] [Error] /home/runner/work/spark/spark/core/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/deploy/master/ZookeeperSuspensionTolerantErrorPolicy.scala:21: object ConnectionStateErrorPolicy is not a member of package org.apache.curator.framework.state
318
[ERROR] [Error] /home/runner/work/spark/spark/core/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/deploy/master/ZookeeperSuspensionTolerantErrorPolicy.scala:26: not found: type ConnectionStateErrorPolicy
319
[ERROR] [Error] /home/runner/work/spark/spark/core/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/deploy/SparkCuratorUtil.scala:47: value connectionStateErrorPolicy is not a member of org.apache.curator.framework.CuratorFrameworkFactory.Builder
```

comments.body:
Hi, 

yes this happens in my local environment now as well (I cherry-picked this from a 2.2 branch before).

The issue is caused because according to the build logs `curator-client-2.13.0.jar` is added to the core classpath by `maven-dependency-plugin:3.1.1` instead of the desired version `4.2.0`.

Strangely `./build/mvn dependency:tree` lists only the correct versions (`4.2.0`) on curator everywhere...

comments.body:
Oversaw a different version in curator that was not present on the previous branch.
Compiles now.
